availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Henderson A. Morse, of New Orleans, Louisiana, having been appointed by The Governor of Kentucky, Commissioner of Deeds &c. for that State, by a Commission, bearing the date of "31st. day of October, 1865"
being first duly sworn
deposes
That he will well, faithfully and truly execute and perform all the duties of his said appointment under and by virtue of the Laws of Kentucky.

Henderson A. Morse,
Att'y at Law, and Commissioner of Deeds
23 Commercial Place, New Orleans
Sworn to and subscribed before the undersigned, on this the 16th day of November, 1865.

K Loery
Dy Clk
U S Dis Court
E. Dist of La

figure.ab: U. S. DISTRICT COURT FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT of LA

HENDERSON A. MORSE
COMMISSIONER
OF DEEDS
FOR THE STATE OF
Kentucky.
NEW ORLEANS, L. A.

body.p:
Comr of Deeds
Louisiana
Oath of M. A. Morse
filed 1st Jany 1865
